summary: Access pertains to the varying degrees and forms of connectivity available across different regions and demographics. The overview highlights the concept of internet fragmentation as outlined in the article "Continental Drift." This article discusses the historical roots and current manifestations of internet fragmentation, categorizing it into technical, governmental, and commercial sectors. Efforts by organizations like the Internet Society to promote a more inclusive and interoperable internet are also highlighted.
excerpt: The article analyzes the fragmentation of the internet, its historical roots, and current forms, highlighting variations in global access and the role of the Internet Society in promoting inclusivity.
